t: Isaiah 9
Birth of the Prince of Peace

Nevertheless,*p the gloom of the distressed land will not be like that of the former times when he humbled the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali. But in the future he will bring honor to the way of the sea, to the land east of the Jordan, and to Galilee of the nations.
The*pn people walking in darkness have*ln seen a great light; a*ln light has dawned on*ln those living in the land of darkness.
You*ln have enlarged the nation and*ln increased its joy. The*ln people have rejoiced before you as*ln they rejoice at harvest time and*ln as they rejoice when dividing spoils.
For*ln you have shattered their oppressive yoke and*ln the rod on their shoulders, the*ln staff of their oppressor, just*ln as you did on the day of Midian.
For*ln every trampling boot of battle and*ln the bloodied garments of war will*ln be burned as fuel for the fire.

For*ln a child will be born for us, a*ln son will be given to us, and*ln the government will be on his shoulders. He*ln will be named Wonderful*ln Counselor, Mighty God, Eternal*ln Father, Prince of Peace.

The*ln dominion will be vast, and*ln its prosperity will never end. He*ln will reign on the throne of David and*ln over his kingdom, to*ln establish and sustain it with*ln justice and righteousness from now on and forever. The*ln zeal of the Lord*s of Armies will accomplish this.
The Hand Raised against Israel
The*pn Lord sent a message against Jacob; it*ln came against Israel.
All*ln the people — Ephraim*ln and the inhabitants of Samaria- will know it. They*ln will say with pride and arrogance,
“The*ln bricks have fallen, but*ln we will rebuild with cut stones; the*ln sycamores have been cut down, but*ln we will replace them with cedars.”
The*ln Lord*s has raised up Rezin’s adversaries against him and*ln stirred up his enemies.
Aram*ln from the east and Philistia from the west have*ln consumed Israel with open mouths. In*ln all this, his anger has not turned away, and*ln his hand is still raised to strike.
The*pn people did not turn to him who struck them; they*ln did not seek the Lord*s of Armies.
So*ln the Lord*s cut off Israel’s head and tail, palm*ln branch and reed in a single day.
The*ln head is the elder, the honored one; the*ln tail is the prophet, the one teaching lies.
The*ln leaders of the people mislead them, and*ln those they mislead are swallowed up.

Therefore*ln the Lord does not rejoice over*ln Israel’s young men and*ln has no compassion on*ln its fatherless and widows, for*ln everyone is a godless evildoer, and*ln every mouth speaks folly. In*ln all this, his anger has not turned away, and*ln his hand is still raised to strike.
For*pn wickedness burns like a fire that*ln consumes thorns and briers and*ln kindles the forest thickets so*ln that they go up in a column of smoke.
The*ln land is scorched by*ln the wrath of the Lord*s of Armies, and*ln the people are like fuel for the fire. No*ln one has compassion on his brother.
They*ln carve meat on the right, but*ln they are still hungry; they*ln have eaten on the left, but*ln they are still not satisfied. Each*ln one eats the flesh of his arm.
Manasseh*ln eats Ephraim, and*ln Ephraim, Manasseh; together,*ln both are against Judah. In*ln all this, his anger has not turned away, and*ln his hand is still raised to strike.
